noun.description: A low four-wheeled cart or barrow used in coal mines.

origin: Early 16th century (denoting a shaft of a barrow; also in tram (sense 2)): from Middle Low German and Middle Dutch trame beam, barrow shaft. In the early 19th century the word denoted the parallel wheel tracks used in a mine, on which the public tramway was modeled; hence tram (sense 1) (late 19th century).
